SEARCH
Package server.Model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Observer.PlayerObservable
server.Model.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, SimplePlayer
public class Player extends PlayerObservable implements Serializable, SimplePlayer
This Class represents a Player in the current game. There can be 2 to 4 players in a game. Each player, identified with a unique nickname within the game, has a Shelf assigned to him to be filled with PlayableItemTiles and a specific PersonalGoal that he will have to try to complete. Have a look at MyShelfie RuleBook for further information
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String nickname, RemoteClientInterface client, GameModel gameModel)
      This method creates an instance of Player also binding it with the actual GameModel
      Parameters:
      nickname - the unique nickname that will identify the Player
      client - the RemoteClientImplementation through which the Player has the possibility to interact with the GameModel and its components
      gameModel - the GameModel to bind

    • getPoints

      public Integer getPoints()
      Returns:
      the amount of points achieved by the Player

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints(Integer points)
      Sets the amount of points achieved by the Player. The points can be awarded after completing one of the CommonGoals, after fulfilling the whole or a part of the PersonalGoal or after placing groups of specific sizes of adjacent PlayableItemTiles of the same Colour inside the Shelf.
      Parameters:
      points - the amount of points to award to the Player

    • getHasCommonGoal1

      public boolean getHasCommonGoal1()
      Returns:
      true if the Player has completed CommonGoal1, false otherwise

    • getHasCommonGoal2

      public boolean getHasCommonGoal2()
      Returns:
      true if the Player has completed CommonGoal2, false otherwise
